alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 11:05AM EST until December 30 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Above Resvr, Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 4.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 6.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 03/23/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 4.6 Thu 10 a 5.5 4.6 6.0 1am 12/29 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
